intro: [WRONG START] Embilia sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping embelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus. The leaves and fruits of Embelia sarmentosa are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
